image.altText: A man wearing a button-up shirt and tie, holding his wife's hand as they walk towards the court.

props.synopsis: Jurors in the criminal trial of celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright are due to hear evidence from more witnesses in the Northern Territory Supreme Court.

title.children: Helicopter pilot saw Matt Wright disconnect flight recorder, court hears

image.altText: A close up of an elderly woman with glasses and white hair.

props.synopsis: Lynette Stewart has hid in bushes and locked herself in rooms to escape the terrifying treatment of a family member. Her experience is why advocates are calling for proper elder abuse legislation.

title.children: Grandmother endures family abuse in a place with few protections for her

image.altText: artworks hanging in a row with a woman in the background

props.synopsis: More than 1,500 First Nations artists from across Australia participated in this year's Darwin Aboriginal Art Fair. It is estimated the fair generates more than $4 million in revenue every year, all of which is returned to communities.

title.children: Darwin Aboriginal Art Fair estimated to generate $4 million of revenue

image.altText: Emily Wurramara with short blonde hair wearing big hoop earings, gold top and holding a fan of feathers

props.synopsis: The 2025 winners of the National Indigenous Music Awards have been announced, highlighting internationally acclaimed and emerging First Nations talent.

title.children: Emily Wurramara wins Artist of the Year at National Indigenous Music Awards

image.altText: A girl smiles while playing the keyboard

props.synopsis: A remote NT school scoops national music awards with songs in Indigenous languages, keeping Dreamtime creation stories alive.

title.children: Award-winning Arnhem Land school keeps languages alive through song

image.altText: A man in a khaki shirt with a camera on his neck holds up an orange lizard in both hands towards camera.

props.synopsis: There is growing momentum in Australia's conservation planning to incorporate First Nations knowledge into the management of culturally significant species such as the great desert skink.

title.children: This lizard faces extinction, but an Indigenous-led plan could save it

image.altText: Willow Brennan wearing a yellow shirt and wide brimmed hat scratches the side of a white cow.

props.synopsis: High school students are learning about animal care and possible careers as the region grapples with a shortage of vets.

title.children: Top End town fights vet shortage by training teenagers in animal care

image.altText: Matt Wright pic (1)

props.synopsis: Bugged phone calls, allegations of lies and planned destruction of evidence — revelations from the first week of the criminal trial against Outback Wrangler Matt Wright.

title.children: Outback Wrangler's bugged midnight phone call at centre of charge

image.altText: a baby boy looking into the camera, a towel loosely covering the top of his head and back

props.synopsis: Family day care makes up just 5 per cent of Australia's early childhood education and care system, but insiders, experts and regulatory documents paint a picture of a sector beset by troubling incidents and structural risk.

title.children: Parents of boy who died in family day care urge authorities to 'wake up'

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX gains on the back of miners and banks, while JB Hi-Fi slips despite announcing a big special dividend. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX led higher by lithium producers, JB Hi-FI announces big dividend and new CEO

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Avita loses more skin on downgrades
ASX 200 gains on miners and banks, JB HiFi tumbles on result

image.altText: A woman, looking on, with art visible on a wall behind her.

props.synopsis: Russia's relentless drone and missile attacks on Ukraine mean the arrival of long-awaited US-made Patriot air defence systems cannot come soon enough.

title.children: 'War of technology' given boost as Patriot air defences head to Ukraine

image.altText: An aerial shot of the University of Western Australia's Crawley campus.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's major universities has suffered a data breach that exposed the password information of thousands of staff and students.

title.children: University of Western Australia suffers major data breach

image.altText: A selfie of a woman with dyed maroon coloured hair

props.synopsis: An English backpacker who hit and killed a man while riding an e-scooter in Perth’s CBD has admitted dangerous driving and drink driving causing death.

title.children: UK backpacker admits drink driving on e-scooter, killing Perth father

image.altText: A man with short grey hair wearing a vest and wetsuit.

props.synopsis: A tourism survey finds about 40 per cent of South Australian businesses impacted by the toxic algal bloom have experienced a downturn in trade as the government's financial support is starting to flow to those affected.

title.children: Algal bloom and 'negative perceptions' affecting SA tourism, survey finds

image.altText: A paramedic stands near a strecher beside an ambulance and a police car parked out the front of a brown brick house at night.

props.synopsis: The 50-year-old has been hospitalised in a serious condition after he was allegedly stabbed by a burglar who police say assaulted his elderly father in Melbourne's west.

title.children: Man stabbed multiple times trying to help 84yo father in home invasion

image.altText: A young girl sitting in a sandy alcove

props.synopsis: Pheobe's family was in court to hear that the brief of evidence was not yet finalised due to "complicating factors" and the matter was adjourned until August 19.

title.children: Pheobe Bishop murder accused Tanika Bromley, James Wood in court

image.altText: A group of people look onto a pile of rubble, a man in high vis stands among the debris.

props.synopsis: An earthquake, with its epicentre in the town of Sindirgi, sends shocks that were felt 200 kilometres to the north in Istanbul — a city of more than 16 million people.

title.children: Deadly Türkiye earthquake destroys more than a dozen buildings

image.altText: Surgeons work on a patient in a hospital surgery.

props.synopsis: Whistleblower doctors who revealed surgeries were being delayed at Orange Hospital have a breakthrough, with local health bosses promising to look into the feasibility of robotic surgery.

title.children: Breakthrough for whistleblower doctors at major NSW hospital

image.altText: Building with people walking in front

props.synopsis: A University of Wollongong student allegedly found with 3D-printed guns in his dorm room has been granted conditional bail.

title.children: Teen granted bail after 3D-printed firearms found on uni campus

image.altText: A black and white photo of London, which looks grainy due to fog

props.synopsis: The Great Smog of London spurred the British to fight for better air quality in the 1950s. As concerns about air pollution surface in Australia, some say the incident still holds lessons.

title.children: 'I couldn't believe the air quality': From London's Great Smog to Launceston

props.synopsis: Despite two poor seasons, climate-change worries and growing competition from Japan and New Zealand, Australian alpine businesses are making substantial investments that signal a firm belief in the future of our winter wonderlands.

title.children: Mega-investment signals fierce belief in Australia's snow business

image.altText: Gabrielle Morrissey

props.synopsis: Gabrielle Morrissey, former CEO of Women and Children First, reached a confidential settlement with the domestic violence charity after it accused her of misappropriating $150,000 for her own benefit.

title.children: Former CEO agrees to pay back $150k to charity she's accused of defrauding

image.altText: A band performs on stage under a mirrorball and a crowd in front of the stage.

props.synopsis: Nine live music venues receive Green Venue certification, as performers and fans seek out venues that are working to reduce their carbon footprint.

title.children: Bands seek green-certified live venues to reduce carbon footprints

image.altText: A bowl of chicken and red rice with yoghurt and salad on the side. A pan of the one pot meal, an easy dinner.

props.synopsis: Tinned tomatoes are a pantry staple for a reason. Here are five weeknight dinners that use them as a base.

title.children: Five easy dinners using tinned tomatoes and pantry staples

image.altText: ,Bel Foster standing on a bare brown escarpment

props.synopsis: The disappearance of beloved trees from Perth's Kings Park leaves a scar across the escarpment and makes it vulnerable to landslides, but provides a chance to future-proof the area amid a drying climate.

title.children: Removal of trees infested with shot-hole borer has surprising outcomes

image.altText: A silhouette of a woman looking at bills.

props.synopsis: As inflation eases, many Australians are still feeling the impact of the cost of living, with the number of people experiencing financial stress almost doubling since the pandemic.

title.children: As financial strain hits, Australians struggle with money dysmorphia

image.altText: Jim Shen stands at the edge of the indoor pool with a pink towel around his neck.

props.synopsis: Heating Australia's beloved aquatic centres comes at a cost to the environment. With centres accounting for more than 50 per cent of some councils' annual emissions, it's putting local government net zero targets at risk.

title.children: Heated public pools threaten Victorian councils' net zero targets

image.altText: A Palestinian woman in a black headdress making a peace symbol with her right hand standing in front of mounds of rubble

props.synopsis: Starving Palestinians in Gaza say they have no other option than to resort to direct online fundraising campaigns and capitalising on social media trends to feed their families.

title.children: Hundreds of millions sent directly to Palestinians through crowdfunding

image.altText: Masked men holding machine guns in the back of a military ute.

props.synopsis: A video of Syrian government forces killing a volunteer medic in a hospital has emerged following clashes between local Druze fighters and Bedouin tribes.

title.children: Syrian government forces kill volunteer medic in hospital

image.altText: a teenage girl with long blonde hair and her mother who had dark brown hair, standing cheek to cheek and smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Polycystic ovary syndrome affects between 6 and 13 per cent of women, but its name has been labelled misleading. An Australian-led initiative is pushing for a global change.

title.children: PCOS sufferers call for 'misleading' name to be changed

image.altText: Two men at press conferences wear suits and stand outside.

props.synopsis: Crossbenchers who could decide the fate of Tasmania's minority government have give mixed responses to new commitments by the Liberals and Labor.

title.children: Policies ditched, promises made as Tasmania's new political reality takes shape

image.altText: A fence post in the foreground with wind turbines in the background

props.synopsis: Two regional NSW councils that already host 42 per cent of the state's wind turbines push back over more projects in the pipeline.

title.children: Towns 'lumped' with 'burden of energy production' push back on wind farms

image.altText: Scott Pendlebury smiles as he high-fives fans over the fence

props.synopsis: Scott Pendlebury will have the chance to break the VFL/AFL games record in 2026 after signing a one-year contract to take his Collingwood career into a 21st season.

title.children: Pendlebury signs on for 21st AFL season, with games record in sight

image.altText: A woman steers her horse through a sharp turn during the campdraft competition.

props.synopsis: A new family friendly event aims to bring people together and put the remote town with a complex history of social dysfunction in a "positive spotlight".

title.children: Rodeo 'right sort of progress' for outback town with high crime rates
